title: How to Make an RJ‚Äê45 Cable

steps.title: Adjust the dial of the wire stripper.
steps.content: Adjust the dial of the wire stripper. Twist the dial until it can cut into your cable without damaging the wires inside. Make sure that it is the right dial to match the size of your cable.

steps.title: Insert the wire into the notch.
steps.content: Insert the wire into the notch. Stick the wire into the notch of the wire stripper and gently squeeze the stripper, so it can cut through the rubber cushioning/insulation. Check to see if the length of the cable is not too short or too long as your inserting it into the notch.

steps.title: Cut through the insulation.
steps.content: Cut through the insulation. Spin the wire stripper around the wire once it cuts the rubber insulation to make sure that the insulation is cut all the way through. Double check to make sure that the inner wires are not damaged, to prevent issues from occurring as you continue!

steps.title: Pull off the cut insulation so that the inner wires are exposed.
steps.content: Pull off the cut insulation so that the inner wires are exposed.

steps.title: Untwist the wires.
steps.content: Untwist the wires. Make it so the colored wires are separated from each other.

steps.title: Organize the wires.
steps.content: Organize the wires. The wires should be organized using the straight through method. Both T-568A and T-569B will work, so pick one of the patterns and apply it to both sides of the cable.

steps.title: Check the length.
steps.content: Check the length. Line up the wiring with connectors to see if the length is good.

steps.title: Cut the excess if the length is longer than needed.
steps.content: Cut the excess if the length is longer than needed.

steps.title: Insert the wires in the connector.
steps.content: Insert the wires in the connector. Slide the wires inside the connector so that it is all the way though.

steps.title: Crimp the connector.
steps.content: Crimp the connector. Use the crimping tool by squeezing the connector relatively hard to secure the wires inside the connector.

steps.title: Double check that all the wires are in the correct order
steps.content: Double check that all the wires are in the correct order

steps.title: Use the crimper on cables.
steps.content: Use the crimper on cables. Be careful because after this point you can not redo anything

steps.title: Test the cables.
steps.content: Test the cables. Test the cables by inserting it into a cable tester or the back end of a router.

steps.title: Plug in the cables for use!
steps.content: Plug in the cables for use!
